data.text:
UKCM sells Bristol office building for ¬£14.5m A Bristol city centre office building has been sold off for ¬£14.5m. British real estate investment firm UK Commercial Property REIT (UKCM) agreed the deal with Tri7, a real estate investment and asset management firm. UK Commercial Property REIT Ltd announced that it has sold its 67,000 sq ft office building in Temple Quay to Tri7, a value-add real estate investment and asset management firm. The investment firm believes the property would benefit from an injection of cash for rejuvenation. The office building is let to the secretary of state for Levelling Up, Housing & Communities until March 2025 and the sale price is in line with the building‚Äôs 31 December 2023 valuation. Tri7 has capital backing to deploy up to ¬£250m on town and city centre regeneration sites that offer bed-led property development opportunities. Will Fulton, fund manager of UKCM at abrdn, said: ‚ÄúAlthough well located in Bristol, this property is close to the end of its economic life with a short lease left to run. Having worked on many options we believe this investment would most benefit from a significant injection of rejuvenation capital a process that necessitates an extended period of no income.‚Äù Samuel Castle, partner at Tri7, said: ‚ÄúIn line with our focus on town and city centre regeneration sites, 2 Rivergate in Bristol provides a compelling opportunity for our value-add strategy. Following soon after our purchase of the Portswood Shopping Centre in Southampton earlier this year, we continue to be on the acquisition trail across the country where our significant level of dry powder coupled with our expertise in unlocking value through asset management means we‚Äôre in a position to take on complex sites and deliver attractive returns.‚Äù UKCM was advised by Joiner Cummings, and Tri7 was advised by Kimmre. #bristol #officespace

UKCM sells Bristol office building for ¬£14.5m A Bristol city centre office building has been sold off for ¬£14.5m. British real estate investment firm UK Commercial Property REIT (UKCM) agreed the deal with Tri7, a real estate investment and asset management firm. UK Commercial Property REIT Ltd announced that it has sold its 67,000 sq ft office building in Temple Quay to Tri7, a value-add real estate investment and asset management firm. The investment firm believes the property would benefit from an injection of cash for rejuvenation. The office building is let to the secretary of state for Levelling Up, Housing & Communities until March 2025 and the sale price is in line with the building‚Äôs 31 December 2023 valuation. Tri7 has capital backing to deploy up to ¬£250m on town and city centre regeneration sites that offer bed-led property development opportunities. Will Fulton, fund manager of UKCM at abrdn, said: ‚ÄúAlthough well located in Bristol, this property is close to the end of its economic life with a short lease left to run. Having worked on many options we believe this investment would most benefit from a significant injection of rejuvenation capital a process that necessitates an extended period of no income.‚Äù Samuel Castle, partner at Tri7, said: ‚ÄúIn line with our focus on town and city centre regeneration sites, 2 Rivergate in Bristol provides a compelling opportunity for our value-add strategy. Following soon after our purchase of the Portswood Shopping Centre in Southampton earlier this year, we continue to be on the acquisition trail across the country where our significant level of dry powder coupled with our expertise in unlocking value through asset management means we‚Äôre in a position to take on complex sites and deliver attractive returns.‚Äù UKCM was advised by Joiner Cummings, and Tri7 was advised by Kimmre. #bristol #officespace

We are thrilled to be able to offer this ‚ÄúJoint venture investment opportunity‚Äù into a commercial property development located within a prime area of central Manchester. This marks the fifth project where our seasoned developer has requested funding from our loyal & dedicated investors. One of their most recent & notable successes was the iconic "22 St John Street", which was fully renovated to offer 13 ‚Äúhigh end‚Äù private office suites for the bustling business community in the city, and was finished ahead of schedule. This latest project involves the renovation of a 9-story office block in the heart of the city. This 30,000 sq/ft property will be transformed into high-quality serviced offices, complete with hot desks, phone booths, conference rooms, and private workspaces. The refurbished property will boast the most modern ‚Äústate of art‚Äù amenities to satisfy the most demanding of tenants with the added advantage of underground parking which is a rarity in central Manchester. This excellent development is one not to be missed. The developer seeks an equity investment of ¬£2.6m with a minimum ¬£100k investment into the project, in return for an equity spilt of 50% of profit. The investor shares will be secured in a SPV over an 24 month period, 12 months for the refurbishment & 12 months to fill with tenants - exit strategy is to either develop & hold or develop & sell once fully let. For further information including a detailed investment memorandum, contact Paul or Austen #jointventures #propertydevelopment #propertyinvestor #investorswanted #manchester #investmentopportunity #commercialdevelopment

PGIM Real Estate plans strata sales at 108 Robinson Road this quarter, capitalizing on strong demand for strata offices. The 12-storey freehold office building, revamped in June 2023, offers a unique opportunity for investors and owner-occupiers in a prime CBD location. The building, subdivided into 11 strata units with freehold tenure, has already leased 30% of its 10 strata office floors. David Fassbender, Managing Director and Senior Portfolio Manager for Asia value-add strategies at PGIM Real Estate, said: '108 Robinson Road provides a unique opportunity for investors and owner-occupiers to acquire a newly refurbished, freehold office property in a prime CBD location, at an attractive investment quantum.' Savills Singapore's data indicates an 85% increase in strata office sales in 2023, totaling about S$2.14 billion. The market anticipates further momentum with potential candidates like 55 Market Street and upcoming supply, signaling a dynamic strata office landscape. #RealEstate #CapitalMarket #CommercialRealEstate #PrivateEquity #FamilyOffices #Singapore I The Business Times I Kalpana Rashiwala

üìåIt's been an exciting quarter for Manchester's commercial property market! According to the latest figures from Place North West, the city's office take-up almost doubled in Q3 - the highest quarterly take-up since the start of 2019. üìä The figures show that Manchester has been the UK's top city for lettings for the second consecutive quarter, with a total of 431,000 sq ft of office space being taken up. The figures are encouraging for commercial property investors and occupiers alike, as it shows that Manchester's office market continues to be one of the most attractive in the UK. If you're looking to invest in commercial property in Manchester, now is apparently a great time to do so! #placeNW #mcrproperty #investinmanchester

Family office purchases landmark Melbourne property - Cushman & Wakefield & Gross Waddell ICR Melbourne Metro commercial property, 1 Dean Street, Moonee Ponds sold by Cushman & Wakefield‚Äôs Daniel Wolman, Oliver Hay, Leon Ma, and negotiated by Gross Waddell ICR‚Äôs Raff De Luise. This acquisition marks a significant milestone, setting a precedent that has generated substantial interest among investors and ignited a wave of new investment mandates. The sale, managed through a highly competitive off-market Invite Only Expressions of Interest process, saw several groups vying for this exceptional property. Ultimately, the High Net Wealth family's decisive and unconditional purchase underscored their confidence in the asset, which attracted significant attention due to its strategic location and potential for future development. Daniel Wolman, Cushman & Wakefield‚Äôs International Director & Co-Head Investment Sales, VIC said: "1 Dean Street stands out as one of the few large commercial assets in Melbourne‚Äôs Northern precinct, offering sustained cash flow and strong future value-add potential. The considerable interest from numerous groups highlights the robust investor appetite for similar assets, indicating a positive trend for future capital deployment in Melbourne‚Äù Read more on COMMO - https://lnkd.in/gKuffmiA Cushman & Wakefield Daniel Wolman Oliver Hay Leon Ma Gross Waddell ICR Raff De Luise Anthony Kirwan Ariel Lu Brittany Delahoy Cameron Zamora George Davies Hamish Burgess Joe Kairouz Josh Andrade Marcus Neill Raphael Favas Andrew Greenway Alex Ham Michael Gross Barry Novy OAM Marney Post Charter Hall Robert Seymour Sean McMahon Fiona Denison #melbre #melbourne #cushmanandwakefield #grosswaddellicr #commercialinvestment #development #landmarkinvestment #landmarksold #melbournerealestate #office #officebuilding #charterhall
